The differences between RCM-based and GCM-based estimates are also apparent in Fig. S5; for example, in the case of Santiago (see Fig. S5f; a major Andean city), TX95 estimates computed from RCM simulations are significantly below GCM simulations. These differences were expected since prior efforts
65 have found (in areas of complicated topography) significant differences between RCM and GCM simulations in SA. In direct contrast to the case of Santiago, differences between RCM-based and GCM-based estimates are minor in the cases of Rochambeau (see Fig. S5c) and Buenos Aires (see Fig. S5g).
